result.execSummary:
The defendant John T Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Judgment for unpaid court obligations.  Refused, unable to forward.
Faxed copy of Judgement of Conviction to Kelly Services

Defendant John T Martin in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant John T Martin in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 15CF29.  No additions or corrections to revocation packet.  Parties make argument to the court.  The court will accept the recommendations of  DOC, will order jail time of 9 months on each count, credit for 233 days, will be allowed huber for child care, cases concurrent, and concurrent to other sentences, may serve jail time in Eau Claire County at no expense to Rusk.
DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John T Martin in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF20.  Case settlement reached in these cases.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  
14CF20- Amend Ct 1 to Felony bail jumping, enter plea of NC-Ct 4, enter a plea of NC-court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Ct's 2-3 will be DRI.
Withhold sentence, 2 yrs probation, will pay restitution of $23.00 and CC on Ct 1.  Ct 4-CC.- one year probation. 

15CF29-amend to Misd bail jumping, dismiss repeater.  DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  DE will proceed w/o prelim hearing in 15CF29, court accepts.  DE will waive PSI preparation.  
Withhold sentence, one year probation-will pay CC.  
Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.   Has credit for 2 days in 15CF29.  Atty will file stipulation to amend JOC when days are calculated in 14CF20.
